title: General Information RA 6713
what: Republic Act No. 6713 is a law that sets the code of conduct and ethical standards for public officials and employees in the Philippines. It promotes honesty, integrity, and accountability in public service.
tutorial: RA 6713 guides how public officials should act, including showing honesty, avoiding corruption, and serving the people with fairness.
steps:
1. Understand the purpose of the law.
  2. Learn its 8 norms of conduct.
  3. Know the duties and responsibilities it requires from public servants.

sections.title: Declaration of Policies
sections.what: This section explains the goal of promoting a high standard of ethics and accountability among public servants.
sections.tutorial: The state declares that public office is a public trust. Public servants must act with responsibility, integrity, and loyalty.
sections.steps:
1. Read the official declaration in the law.
  2. Understand its importance in building trust in government.
  3. Apply it in your daily work as a public servant.

sections.title: Norms of Conduct
sections.what: These are the 8 guiding behaviors expected from every public official or employee.
sections.tutorial: The 8 Norms are: Commitment to public interest, Professionalism, Justness and sincerity, Political neutrality, Responsiveness to the public, Nationalism and patriotism, Commitment to democracy, and Simple living.
sections.steps:
1. Memorize the 8 norms.
  2. Understand what each one means.
  3. Reflect how you apply them in work and life.

sections.title: 1. Commitment to Public Interest
sections.what: This norm means putting the people's needs above personal interest.
sections.tutorial: Example: Don't use public funds for private activities.
sections.steps:
1. Think before making decisions.
  2. Ask if it benefits the public.
  3. Avoid any actions for personal gain.

sections.title: 2. Professionalism
sections.what: Professionalism means doing your job well, honestly, and on time.
sections.tutorial: Always report to work on time and finish tasks with quality.
sections.steps:
1. Be punctual.
  2. Respect work rules and ethics.
  3. Strive to improve your performance.

sections.title: 3. Justness and Sincerity
sections.what: Justness means being fair. Sincerity means being honest.
sections.steps:
1. Be truthful in your actions and decisions.
  2. Don't take bribes or gifts.
  3. Uphold fairness and equality.

sections.title: 4. Political Neutrality
sections.what: Public servants must not favor any political party or candidate while on duty.
sections.tutorial: Stay neutral especially during elections while doing public duties.
sections.steps:
1. Don't campaign for candidates during work.
  2. Serve all people fairly, regardless of politics.
  3. Focus on service, not politics.

sections.title: 5. Responsiveness to the Public
sections.what: This means public servants must serve the people quickly and politely.
sections.tutorial: Answer questions clearly and help clients as soon as possible.
sections.steps:
1. Listen carefully to citizens.
  2. Act promptly on requests or concerns.
  3. Be kind and respectful in communication.

sections.title: 6. Nationalism and Patriotism
sections.what: Love and loyalty to the country and working for its progress.
sections.tutorial: Support local products, speak positively of the nation, and defend its interest.
sections.steps:
1. Show respect for the flag and laws.
  2. Promote Filipino values and culture.
  3. Be proud of being a Filipino.

sections.title: 7. Commitment to Democracy
sections.what: This means respecting the rights of people and following democratic processes.
sections.tutorial: Support freedom of speech and fair elections.
sections.steps:
1. Respect public opinion and rights.
  2. Uphold rule of law.
  3. Participate in lawful and civic duties.

sections.title: 8. Simple Living
sections.what: This means living within your means and avoiding luxury while in public service.
sections.tutorial: Don't flaunt wealth. Avoid extravagant spending especially from public funds.
sections.steps:
1. Use resources wisely.
  2. Dress and live modestly.
  3. Be a good role model of humility.

sections.title: Duties of Public Officials
sections.what: RA 6713 defines what all public servants must do, like submitting SALN and avoiding conflict of interest.
sections.tutorial: Submit SALN every year, avoid gifts, and always act in public interest.
sections.steps:
1. Read the list of required duties under the law.
  2. Understand the meaning and importance of each duty.
  3. Practice them in your service daily.

sections.title: Statement of Assets, Liabilities, and Net Worth (SALN)
sections.what: SALN is a yearly document that shows your income, properties, liabilities, and financial interests.
sections.tutorial: Example: Include all your cars, house, land, and bank accounts in the SALN truthfully.
sections.steps:
1. Gather all documents about your income and properties.
  2. Fill up the official SALN form honestly.
  3. Submit it on time to the right office.

sections.title: Prohibited Acts and Penalties
sections.what: This section tells what actions are not allowed and their punishments (e.g., accepting gifts or using position for gain).
sections.tutorial: Don’t accept gifts for services. Don’t use position to benefit friends or relatives.
sections.steps:
1. Read the list of prohibited acts under RA 6713.
  2. Understand the possible penalties like suspension or dismissal.
  3. Avoid any action that could lead to violations.
